question: who was executed for being an american spy during the revolutionary war
chain_of_thought_result: The individual executed for being an American spy during the Revolutionary War was Nathan Hale. He was a soldier and spy for the Continental Army who was captured by the British in 1776. Hale was sentenced to death and hanged on September 22, 1776. His famous last words were reportedly, "I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country."
